intro: Corylopsis macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stamened flame-twist, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-yellow floral display in late winter to early spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sun. Corylopsis macrostachya is valued in gardens for its early blooming habit and ornamental appeal.
